Key Match Events: Brazil missed a string of chances and were held 0-0 by Costa Rica in their Copa América Group D opener.
Brazil dominated possession but lacked precision in front of goal with just three of their 19 shots on target.
Costa Rica's five-man defense contained Brazil and deprived them of space.
Raphinha had an early opportunity to score but Costa Rica keeper Patrick Sequeira came off his line to snuff out the danger.
Brazil thought they had scored in the 30th minute but the goal was disallowed for offside after a lengthy VAR delay.
Lucas Paquetá rattled the woodwork with a long-range effort in the 63rd minute.
Guilherme Arana's strike was kept out by a fine save from Sequeira.
Coach Dorival Junior brought on youngsters Endrick and Sávio in the 70th minute as Brazil sought a winner.
Paqueta twice shot wide in the final 10 minutes as Brazil failed to break the deadlock.
Post-Match Reflections: Brazil defender Marquinhos emphasized the importance of creating alternatives to score and the significance of early points in the competition.
Costa Rica coach Gustavo Alfaro commented on the team's underdog status, comparing it to Bruce Willis in 'The Sixth Sense'.
Paqueta expressed frustration at not winning but maintained confidence in the team's performance and highlighted the need to improve finishing.
Neymar, Brazil's all-time leading scorer, looked dejected as he watched from the stands due to an anterior cruciate ligament injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Colombia leads Group D following their 2-1 win over Paraguay earlier on Monday.
The match was held at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California, with an attendance of 67,158.
